summary: To prevent the further spread of the Ebola virus, we must end all flights out of the infected country(s), minimize travel in and out of the known infected country(s) to the best of the ability, and of course treat the sick with the already established "clean clinics." Halting all the flights out of the infected country(s) is a global prevention method, which will allow for more resources to be used at the local level in Africa. Minimizing traffic flow into and out of the infected country(s) can be considered both local and global preventive measures, because this will not permit the disease to find a escape route and stay in the designated target areas (not infecting anymore in other countries, and in the small villages in which it began).
title: How might we prevent the continued spread of the Ebola virus,  globally and in the target regions?
